column4: Well crap, it's still not working. Gonna ask again one last time. I just recently installed ubuntu desktop 7.10, booted it up, logged in then got scsi 2:0:0:0: rejecting I/O dead device error. I then reboot, and get grub error 17, I then have gone to try and reinstall. But when I get to the "prepare partitions" it doesn't list that I have any.
hmm, any show in GPartEd?
It's scanning all devices still..taking a bit
a minute max, there might be something up with that HDD
what does sudo fdisk -l say?
sudo fdisk -l? like the letter L?
if you need access to your HDD data, I advise plugging it into another machine
I suspect something hardware wise
well, I found a bad memory module in a new one that had strange crashes :P
or a new computer :P
I'm afraid to say this but your hard drive might have crapped out or something :(
then that Windows partition is bai bai if you were not aware
oh, ok!
that was guided - resize :)
but anyway
the partition screen basically says nice and unreadable your HDD?
probably best shot now is to plug HDD into another machine, see if you can read anything out
right now I guess if you can, burn or make a USB bootable for Linux System Rescue CD or Rescubuntu Remix
might be a shot at data recovery
wish you luck with your probs, but I must go for the night :( cya
